name: sbpmproject
short_description:
sbpm (Smart Binary Package Manager) is a Linux package manager, like RPM, etc.
sbpm use a tarball to archive the program data. (prefix with /bin, /lib, etc). and a tarball within control informations. This frame is similar to debain package. It also has the dependencies tracker. ldd-tracker and package-tracker. ldd-tracker track the every binary executable file and libraries (with ELF format) . if it can't find any libraries (for example, liblzma.so.0.0 ) on system, it will get failed to install this package. in fact, package-tracker is optional in sbpm. Slackware package didn't use dependencies, and it keep flexible. both of RPM and debain-apt lack of this. sbpm use ldd-tracker to detect whether binary libraries on system mainly. package-tracker detect needed packages, and package still can been installed if package-dependencies not statisfied but all binary libraries (with extension of .so) are found  on system.
